instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 PPbus_g3h unstable/pulsing
threads.message:
Hi,
I've got a 820-3437 board here that won't turn on. Magsafe light is on, but nothing else happens. PPBUS_G3H is around 8.56 volts but isn't stable. Replaced ISL6259, didn't help.
Any suggestions where to look next?
Thanks, Rick

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 PPbus_g3h unstable/pulsing
threads.message:
Resistance ISL6259:
* 17/18: 3 ohms
* 27/28: 20 ohms

PPDCIN_G3H: Varies slightly between 16.65 and 16.66v

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 PPbus_g3h unstable/pulsing
threads.message:
[QUOTE="rvanpruissen, post: 19812"]Resistance ISL6259:
* 17/18: 3 ohms
* 27/28: 20 ohms

PPDCIN_G3H: Varies slightly between 16.65 and 16.66v[/QUOTE]

That's only 10mV... Negligible.
You got 3V42?
S5 rails?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 PPbus_g3h unstable/pulsing
threads.message: Thanks. I think all S5 rails are fluctuating because of PPBUS_G3H. None of them are 0V.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 PPbus_g3h unstable/pulsing
threads.message: Does the machine power from a charged battery? R7105 ok?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 PPbus_g3h unstable/pulsing
threads.message:
R7105 measures fine. Tried the machine with it's own battery (status unknown) and this seems to stabilise PPBUS_G3H at 8.67V. I'll try and find a properly charged battery next. Any suggestions as to what this means and what my next step would be? Kind of lost on this one.
Thanks, Rick

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 PPbus_g3h unstable/pulsing
threads.message:
Nope, know good battery doesn't change a thing compared to above. So info so far:

* PPBUS_G3H is around 8.56 volts but isn't stable (stabilises at 8.67V with battery attached)
* Resistance ISL6259 (replaced):
   - 17/18: 3 ohms
   - 27/28: 20 ohms
* PPDCIN_G3H: Varies slightly between 16.65 and 16.66v (stabilised when ISL was removed)
* No S5 rails present, they are fluctuating because of PPBUS_G3H. None of them are 0V.

Any suggestions?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 PPbus_g3h unstable/pulsing
threads.message:
Never mind, I just fixed this one. PP5V_S4RS3 was shorted on C7553. Repealed and replaced it and now it's working again. Thanks for your suggestions people.
Cheers, Rick
